snippet: Romney campaign advisers have hinted that he may defy custom by disclosing his vice-presidential pick well ahead of the Republican convention.
abstract: Campaign advisers to presumptive Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney hint that he may defy custom and disclose his vice-presidential pick well ahead of the Republican convention; say with polls showing a close race, a warmly received running mate could significantly energize Romney's candidacy.
lead_paragraph: Romney campaign advisers have hinted that he may defy custom by disclosing his vice-presidential pick well ahead of the Republican convention.

headline.main: After the Who, the Question of the When
